dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, so, big news this week. President Biden is finally, uh, unveiling his massive infrastructure plan.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, so, big news this week. President Biden is finally, uh, unveiling his massive infrastructure plan.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: After weeks of anticipation, President Biden will unveil on Wednesday a sweeping proposal to revitalize American infrastructure and manufacturing, begin the transition to clean energy and industry and create jobs

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's been, like, weeks of anticipation, right? And it sounds pretty sweeping. We're talking infrastructure, manufacturing, clean energy... all of it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's been, like, weeks of anticipation, right? And it sounds pretty sweeping. We're talking infrastructure, manufacturing, clean energy... all of it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: After weeks of anticipation, President Biden will unveil on Wednesday a sweeping proposal to revitalize American infrastructure and manufacturing, begin the transition to clean energy and industry and create jobs

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And the price tag, um, is a cool two trillion dollars. He wants Congress to approve that, spent over eight years.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And the price tag, um, is a cool two trillion dollars. He wants Congress to approve that, spent over eight years.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The $2 trillion Biden will ask Congress to approve for his American Jobs Plan will be spent over a period of eight years and paid for with tax hikes over a period of 15 years.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Two trillion? Wow. And how are they planning to pay for that, then? Because, like, that's a lot of money.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Two trillion? Wow. And how are they planning to pay for that, then? Because, like, that's a lot of money.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Good question. They're looking at tax hikes over 15 years. Mainly, uh, raising the corporate rate from 21% to 28%.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Good question. They're looking at tax hikes over fifteen years. Mainly, uh, raising the corporate rate from twenty one percent to twenty eight percent.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The $2 trillion Biden will ask Congress to approve for his American Jobs Plan will be spent over a period of eight years and paid for with tax hikes over a period of 15 years. ... To help pay for all that spending, the Biden administration is expected to propose a series of major tax changes including raising the corporate rate from 21% to 28%

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, so that's where the money comes from. And what's actually *in* this two trillion? I mean, what are the big buckets?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, so that's where the money comes from. And what's actually in this two trillion? I mean, what are the big buckets?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, a huge chunk, like $621 billion, is for transportation – roads, bridges, you know, the usual. But also, $174 billion specifically for the electric vehicle market.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, a huge chunk, like six hundred twenty one billion dollars, is for transportation - roads, bridges, you know, the usual. But also, one hundred seventy four billion dollars specifically for the electric vehicle market.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Included in that $2 trillion is $621 billion for transportation infrastructure like roads and bridges, with $174 billion of that set aside for the electric vehicle market

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Electric vehicles, yeah, that's big. And I saw something about water, too?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Electric vehicles, yeah, that's big. And I saw something about water, too?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yep, $111 billion for clean drinking water. Plus, a hundred billion for expanding broadband, which is, uh, pretty crucial these days. And another hundred for the power grid.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yep, one hundred eleven billion dollars for clean drinking water. Plus, a hundred billion for expanding broadband, which is, uh, pretty crucial these days. And another hundred for the power grid.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: $111 billion for clean drinking water, $100 billion for expanding broadband and $100 billion for power infrastructure like the electric grid.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So it's not just, like, old roads, it's very forward-looking stuff too. What about, um, people? Is there anything for housing or jobs?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So it's not just, like, old roads, it's very forward-looking stuff too. What about, um, people? Is there anything for housing or jobs?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. $213 billion for affordable housing, $400 billion for the care economy, and a hundred billion for workforce development. So, a lot of different areas.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. two hundred thirteen billion dollars for affordable housing, four hundred billion dollars for the care economy, and a hundred billion for workforce development. So, a lot of different areas.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Theres also $213 billion for affordable and sustainable housing, $400 billion for the care economy and $100 billion for workforce development.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It really is comprehensive. But, you know, with a price tag like that, there's always going to be criticism. What are we hearing?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really is comprehensive. But, you know, with a price tag like that, there's always going to be criticism. What are we hearing?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, tons. Republicans are, uh, definitely balking at the cost and the idea of reversing some of the Trump-era tax cuts.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, tons. Republicans are, uh, definitely balking at the cost and the idea of reversing some of the Trump-era tax cuts.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While Republicans are sure to balk at the price tag and the potential repeal of many of President Trumps tax cuts for big companies and wealthy individuals to pay for the plan

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And on the other side, I heard some progressives are saying it's *not enough*? Like AOC tweeted that.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And on the other side, I heard some progressives are saying it's not enough? Like A O C tweeted that.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: some progressives are saying the package should be larger. This is not nearly enough, Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez tweeted Tuesday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: She did, yeah. So it's getting hit from both sides, which is, um, kind of typical for these big packages.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: She did, yeah. So it's getting hit from both sides, which is, um, kind of typical for these big packages.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right. And this follows the $1.9 trillion American Rescue Plan, which, you know, just passed. How's this one likely to get through Congress?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. And this follows the one point nine trillion dollar American Rescue Plan, which, you know, just passed. How's this one likely to get through Congress?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The American Jobs plan follows the $1.9 trillion American Rescue Plan, which Biden signed into law earlier this month.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: That's the big question. The Rescue Plan went through using budget reconciliation, with just Democrats. It's not clear yet if they'll try that again, or if they'll seek bipartisan support.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's the big question. The Rescue Plan went through using budget reconciliation, with just Democrats. It's not clear yet if they'll try that again, or if they'll seek bipartisan support.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The American Rescue Plan was passed by Democrats over the objections of the Republican party using a special legislative process called budget reconciliation. Its not yet clear whether Democrats will attempt to use reconciliation for the infrastructure package or whether they will seek enough Republican votes to pass the bill using the standard process.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Hmm. So, a lot of unknowns there. But, uh, any specific industries that might particularly benefit?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hmm. So, a lot of unknowns there. But, uh, any specific industries that might particularly benefit?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Funnily enough, Bank of America analysts are predicting that companies making semiconductors – you know, computer chips for everything – are really poised to profit from this digital infrastructure push.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Funnily enough, Bank of America analysts are predicting that companies making semiconductors - you know, computer chips for everything - are really poised to profit from this digital infrastructure push.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Analysts from Bank of America predict that companies that manufacture the equipment used to make semiconductorsthe computer chips found in everything from cars to smartphonesare poised to profit from Bidens push to modernize the United States digital infrastructure and shore up domestic production of the essential computer components as part of his $2 trillion plan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Interesting! So even beyond the obvious stuff. And, um, is this the whole plan, or is there more to come?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Interesting! So even beyond the obvious stuff. And, um, is this the whole plan, or is there more to come?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: This is just part one. The second part, focusing on healthcare and childcare, is expected next month. So, yeah, a lot more to unpack.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: This is just part one. The second part, focusing on healthcare and childcare, is expected next month. So, yeah, a lot more to unpack.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Biden is expected to introduce the second part of his American Jobs Plan next month. That proposal will include provisions related to healthcare and childcare.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. So this is just the beginning of, uh, a very busy legislative period.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. So this is just the beginning of, uh, a very busy legislative period.
